definition: to help/to assist/to support/for sb (i.e. as a help)/hired (as worker)/side (of pail, boat etc)/outer layer/upper (of a shoe)/group/gang/clique/party/secret society
to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
to amuse oneself/to play with/to tease
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
to share tribulations/to help sb with worries and difficulties
to suffer defeat in every battle (idiom)
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
to touch base matter and turn it to gold (idiom); fig. to turn crude writing into a literary gem
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to show off one's military strength (idiom); to strut around/to bluff/to bluster
